Package Models

Class MineSweeperBoard

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
Models.MineSweeperBoard
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class MineSweeperBoard extends Observable implements Serializable
This class holds the model for a game of Minesweeper, focusing on the gameplay area itself. The grid of tiles is stored as a 2D array of MineSweeperTiles here, while the class keeps track of gameplay information that needs to be stored, such as elapsed time and variables that are relevant during setup. The class also updates its observers with any changes to the board state.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • MineSweeperBoard

      public MineSweeperBoard(String difficulty)
      Constructor for the MineSweeperBoard model object.
      Parameters:
      difficulty - A string representing the difficulty of the game, which affects board size and mine density.

  • Method Details

    • setBoardDimensions

      public void setBoardDimensions(String difficulty)
      This takes in a difficulty and changes the board dimensions to match that
      Parameters:
      difficulty - - the difficulty for this board

    • createBoard

      public void createBoard(int row, int col)
      Places all the mines and unmined tiles once the player clicks the first tile.
      Parameters:
      row - is the y coord of the first tile clicked
      col - is the x coord of the first tile clicked

    • updateTileStatus

      public void updateTileStatus(int row, int col, GUESS_STATUS status)
      Updates the tile to the indicated status parameter.
      Parameters:
      row - is the y coord of the tile to be updated
      col - is the x coord of the tile to be updated
      status - is the new status of the tile

    • notifyObservers

      public void notifyObservers()
      This method notifies observers when the board has changed.
      Overrides:
      notifyObservers in class Observable

    • createBombs

      public void createBombs(int startRow, int startCol)
      This method places bombs in random locations once the user clicks on the board for the first time. It will never place them within 2 hexes of the user's first click, to ensure the game is playable and that the first click gives useful information.
      Parameters:
      startRow - The row that the user originally clicked.
      startCol - The column that the user originally clicked.

    • createBoardTimer

      public void createBoardTimer(Runnable updateTimer)
      This creates a new executor to increase the timer on the board We create a scheduled executor to decrease computing time of using a while true loop
      Parameters:
      updateTimer - - the runnable to call every update cycle. For text, this would be printing, for view, this would be updating the label

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      This terminates the executor so it is not running after the game is over

    • getBoard

      public MineSweeperTile[][] getBoard()
      Method to return the entire board
      Returns:
      the board object as a MineSweeperTile 2D array

    • setBoard

      public void setBoard(MineSweeperTile[][] newBoard)
      Sets the board to an existing board, from a loaded file.

    • setObserver

      public void setObserver(Observer o)
      Adds an observer to notify of changes.
      Parameters:
      o - The observer to add, presumably a view object.

    • disableTimer

      public void disableTimer()
      Disables the game timer by setting the time increment to 0ms We call this when we pause the game

    • enableTimer

      public void enableTimer()
      Enables the game timer by setting the time increment to DELTA_TIME_MS We call this when we resume the game

    • isGamePaused

      public boolean isGamePaused()
      This determines if the game is paused by checking if the timer is active
      Returns:
      - true if the game is paused (the timer is inactive), false otherwise

    • setSecondsElapsed

      public void setSecondsElapsed(int elapsed)
      Updates the number of milliseconds elapsed to match an input in seconds.
      Parameters:
      elapsed - An integer number of seconds to update the timer to.

    • getSecondsElapsed

      public double getSecondsElapsed()
      Adds a certain number of milliseconds to the elapsed time. Then calculates the number of seconds that have elapsed in the game, and returns it as a double.
      Returns:
      The number of elapsed seconds, as a double.

    • getDifficulty

      public String getDifficulty()
      Returns:
      This game's difficulty setting, expressed as a string (like "Easy" or "Very Hard").

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Returns:
      The number of rows in the Minesweeper board.

    • getCols

      public int getCols()
      Returns:
      The number of columns in the Minesweeper board.

    • getNumBombs

      public int getNumBombs()
      Returns the numBombs variable, which stores the number of bombs on the board. Note that this is the intended number of bombs to place, before game setup, and not the number that actually *were* placed (if, somehow, it might be different).
      Returns:
      The number of bombs on the Minesweeper board.

    • getNumFlags

      public int getNumFlags()
      This function searches through all the tiles in the board and counts the number of flagged tiles
      Returns:
      - the number of tiles which have been flagged

    • setNumBombs

      public void setNumBombs(int newNumBombs)
      Sets the *displayed* and *calculated* number of bombs on the board, not the actual number of tiles with bombs on them! This method is called when loading from a saved file, to ensure that we keep using the saved target number of bombs to end the game, rather than the overwritten target number.
      Parameters:
      newNumBombs - The new such number of bombs.

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty(String newDifficulty)
      Sets the *written* difficulty of the board, not the actual in-game difficulty! This method is called when loading from a saved file, to ensure that we save to the correct scoreboard slot, rather than that of the game we overwrote.
      Parameters:
      newDifficulty - The new such difficulty.
